bug.author: robinfays12
bug.description:
Hello, When I'm running your code on Jupyter-lab (Windows) here : <denchmark-link:https://github.com/intel-isl/Open3D/blob/master/examples/Python/ReconstructionSystem/sensors/azure_kinect_recorder.py>https://github.com/intel-isl/Open3D/blob/master/examples/Python/ReconstructionSystem/sensors/azure_kinect_recorder.py</denchmark-link>
I have this problem : <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56922763/79070990-5b50f080-7cd9-11ea-97ae-ad2468a3828a.png></denchmark-link>
Can you help me please ! Thanks Robin Fays

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/robinfays12>@robinfays12</denchmark-link> could you try using our bug report template so that we can get more input on this?
Please try again in a native python environment (e.g. from ananconda) on Windows. The azure Kinect support is not supported on Jupyter currently since it involves our custom visualizer.
